questions.question: What is the lesson the story teaches?
questions.definition: A lesson about right conduct; what a story teaches.

questions.question: A particular way of looking at something
Another word for view
questions.definition: The ability to see; also what is seen.

questions.question: Before you speak, try to...
questions.definition: To use your mind to form ideas and judgments.

questions.question: A feeling or perception about something
To look closely and notice details
To form an opinion too quickly
questions.definition: To decide without full evidence; to evaluate.

questions.question: A formal examination in court
questions.definition: A legal hearing to decide a case.

questions.question: Where legal cases are heard
questions.definition: A place where justice is administered.

questions.question: A person who serves on a jury
questions.definition: A citizen selected to decide facts in a case.

questions.question: A rule that controls what happens
questions.definition: A command or arrangement; a rule.

questions.question: A small tool the judge may use
questions.definition: A mallet used to keep order in court.

questions.question: To say something as a fact
Evidence that supports a claim
questions.definition: Something that shows a statement is true.

questions.question: What a witness takes in court
questions.definition: To promise formally to tell the truth.

questions.question: To hide the truth by twisting it
questions.definition: To cast doubt or alter perception.

questions.question: Not the whole picture
questions.definition: A small part or segment of something.

questions.question: Showing courage in the face of fear
questions.definition: Willing to face danger or difficulty.

questions.question: Boldness or courage to act
questions.definition: The confidence to do something difficult.

questions.question: To remain firm under pressure
questions.definition: To hold your ground; not back down.

questions.question: Compassion shown to someone in pain
To notice how someone else feels
To offer kindness you didn't have to
To give your time and care
To exchange feelings or support
questions.definition: To give a part of yourself to others.

questions.question: Speak up for someone else
questions.definition: To express support or concern aloud.

questions.question: The ability to influence or control
questions.definition: The capacity to act or affect outcomes.

questions.question: To make something happen by strength
questions.definition: To compel by physical or social pressure.

questions.question: Currency; resources that enable choice
questions.definition: Wealth in the form of cash or assets.

questions.question: A social group with shared status
questions.definition: A group divided by wealth or role.

questions.question: A short break or hesitation
questions.definition: A moment to stop and think.

questions.question: A person who keeps to themselves
questions.definition: Someone who prefers to be alone.

questions.question: A feeling of being left out
High respect; doing what is right
questions.definition: Integrity and respect earned through actions.

questions.question: A strong moral principle
questions.definition: A guiding belief about right and wrong.

questions.question: A fair and equal treatment
questions.definition: The same in value, amount, or status.

questions.question: To keep your word
questions.definition: Firm belief in someone or something.

questions.question: To gain knowledge or skill
questions.definition: To understand through study or experience.

questions.question: To examine carefully for understanding
questions.definition: To learn by reading or practice.

questions.question: A plan for improving
questions.definition: To adjust based on new information.

questions.question: Look back and summarize what you learned
A moment that changes everything
questions.definition: A change in direction or thinking.

questions.question: To ask questions instead of assuming
To make meaning from a story
questions.definition: To reach a conclusion from evidence.
